input.rev_rec_notes: Capacity commitment is invoiced annually in advance (ramp by contract year) but is a prepaid consumption right - revenue recognized as credits are consumed. Overage/storage are billed monthly in arrears and recognized as-used. Services are milestone-based (kickoff + go-live).
input.use_case_description: Snowflake signs a 3-year enterprise Order Form for the Snowflake AI Data Cloud modeled as a capacity commitment (prepaid consumption credits) with an annual ramp and an on-demand overage rate once the committed balance is exhausted. Create a Subscription with a Ramp (or three annual segments) for the Capacity Commitment rate plan: Year 1 committed spend $750,000 billed annually in advance; Year 2 $1,250,000 billed annually in advance; Year 3 $2,000,000 billed annually in advance (all demo pricing). Treat the committed spend as a prepaid drawdown balance that is relieved as usage occurs, using usage imports (e.g., credits consumed) to drive recognition rather than straight-line over the year. Add a separate Usage charge for Overage Consumption billed monthly in arrears at $5.75 per credit once the committed credit balance is depleted (and/or for usage explicitly classified as overage), with invoices generated monthly based on usage records. Optionally include metered storage as a separate usage component at $30 per TB-month billed monthly in arrears (kept separate from the committed credit pool for demo clarity). Include a Professional Services rate plan for implementation/migration/training sold alongside the commit as a fixed-fee SOW: $200,000 total, invoiced 50% at kickoff and 50% at go-live, with the commercial intent that services support adoption of the platform during Year 1. Apply a negotiated bundle discount of 10% off list across the committed spend and services to force allocation in revenue (allocate discount across POBs using list prices as SSP proxies). Revenue expectation (inferred): committed capacity is recognized as the customer consumes credits (release from deferred as-used); overage and storage are recognized as-used/as-billed in the monthly period; services are recognized as delivered (over time or at milestone depending on SOW acceptance criteria).

hints: “capacity commitment (prepaid consumption credits)” / “prepaid drawdown balance” → PREPAID DRAWDOWN + ADVANCED CONSUMPTION
“usage imports … credits consumed” / “invoices generated monthly based on usage records” → USAGE
“overage rate once the committed balance is exhausted” / “billed monthly in arrears” → OVERAGE
“bundle discount of 10% off list across the committed spend and services” → DISCOUNT + BUNDLE
“allocate discount across POBs using list prices as SSP proxies” → ALLOCATION
“drive recognition rather than straight-line … as usage occurs” and “milestone-based (kickoff + go-live)” → CUSTOM EVENT

subscription.name: Snowflake AI Data Cloud - 3YR Capacity Commitment (Ramp) + Overage + PS

rate_plans.ratePlanName: Metered Storage (Optional, Separate from Commit Pool)

assumptions: Subscription end date is derived from termMonths=36: 2026-01-01 + 36 months = 2029-01-01.
10% negotiated bundle discount is represented via sellPrice < listPrice on the committed spend and PS charges (overage/storage are not discounted).
Allocation is expected in ZR using listPrice as SSP proxy across the committed capacity POB(s) and PS POB(s); transaction price is the discounted sell price.

Capacity commitment revenue is driven by consumption events (credits) imported during each contract year; unused amounts remain deferred until consumed (or until an expiry/breakage policy is applied).

Sample consumption events assume an illustrative committed drawdown valuation of $5.00 per credit to populate the 'Amount' field; actual $/credit (or whether events are quantity-only) must be confirmed.
Overage usage is provided as separate usage records once committed balance is exhausted and/or usage is explicitly classified as overage by the metering system.
Go-live milestone date is assumed as 2026-06-01 for demo purposes; replace with actual go-live milestone/acceptance date.
Storage is included as an optional, separate usage component and is explicitly not part of the committed credit pool.
open_questions: For the capacity commitment consumption events: will Snowflake provide consumption as (a) credits only, (b) dollars only, or (c) both? This determines whether EVT-PIT-CONSUMP-USAGE (qty-driven) or EVT-PIT-AMOUNT (amount-driven) is operationally cleaner.
What is the contractual committed drawdown rate (implied $ per credit) used to convert consumed credits into revenue release amounts (and does it differ by year)?
Do committed credits expire at each contract year boundary (use-it-or-lose-it), roll forward, or true-up at year end? (Impacts recognition window and any breakage handling.)
What is the actual go-live milestone date and what is the controlling criterion: 'Completion' vs 'Acceptance'?
Should professional services be purely milestone point-in-time (kickoff + go-live), or partially over-time (e.g., POC/hours) if the SOW specifies ongoing delivery?

charge_pob_map.rationale: Annual invoice is deferred; revenue is released/recognized only when consumption (credits) is reported during Year 1.

alternatives.why_not: Use only if you will import dollar-based BY_AMOUNT events (not quantity/credits).

alternatives.pob_name: Consumption Ratable with VC upon booking
alternatives.why_not: Would introduce ratable recognition mechanics; not aligned to strict as-consumed recognition.

charge_pob_map.rationale: Year 2 ramped prepayment remains deferred until consumed; usage events drive release within the Year 2 window.

alternatives.why_not: Use only if consumption will be supplied as BY_AMOUNT events rather than credit quantities.

charge_pob_map.rationale: Year 3 ramped prepayment is recognized as consumed via usage events (not straight-line).

alternatives.pob_name: Consumption Ratable without VC upon booking
alternatives.why_not: Ratable recognition would not meet the stated 'recognize as credits are consumed' intent.

charge_pob_map.rationale: Overage is invoiced monthly in arrears from usage; recognize in the billed/usage period.

alternatives.why_not: Use if you prefer consumption-event release instead of billing-based release for overage.

charge_pob_map.ratePlanName: Metered Storage (Optional, Separate from Commit Pool)
charge_pob_map.rationale: Metered storage is billed monthly in arrears; recognize in the monthly billed period.

alternatives.why_not: Use if storage revenue should be released strictly upon consumption events rather than billing.

charge_pob_map.rationale: Milestone-based services: recognize kickoff portion when the kickoff milestone is completed/accepted.

alternatives.why_not: Use if formal customer acceptance (not completion) is the controlling criterion.

charge_pob_map.rationale: Milestone-based services: recognize go-live portion when go-live milestone is completed/accepted.

alternatives.why_not: Only use if services (or a go-live-related deliverable) should be amortized over time starting at go-live.

mapping_notes: Allocation: Ensure ZR is configured to allocate discount across POBs using listPrice as SSP proxy (per your instruction). The primary mechanism here is listPrice vs sellPrice on each charge.

Capacity commitment: Mapping uses EVT-PIT-CONSUMP-USAGE so recognition is event-driven (as-consumed) rather than ratable—even though billing is annual in advance. This requires consumption events to be imported and linked to the commitment POB(s).
Ramp years: Separate annual commitment charge segments create clean year-specific deferral buckets and prevent retrospective changes when the ramp steps up.

Overage/storage: BL-PIT-CONSUMP-PAYGO recognizes in the billed period (monthly in arrears). If you prefer recognition strictly on consumption event timing (independent of invoice timing), switch to EVT-PIT-CONSUMP-PAYGO.
Services: EVT-PIT-COMPLETION assumes milestone completion events are available/maintained; if customer sign-off is required, use EVT-PIT-ACCEPTAN instead.

assumptions: Billing schedule is generated for the termed subscription from 01/01/2026 through 01/01/2029 (36 months).
Annual Capacity Commitment ramp segments are assumed to align exactly to yearly boundaries (01/01–01/01), so no proration is applied.
Billing Timing InAdvance for the annual flat-fee commitment charges is treated as billing on the segment start date (Invoice Date = Billing Date = segment start).
A negotiated 10% bundle discount is applied as a net price reduction to the three Capacity Commitment charges and the two Professional Services milestone charges (usage charges are not discounted).

Usage charges (Overage Credits and Optional Metered Storage) are billed Monthly InArrears with Billing Date set to the period end date, modeled as the 1st day of the following month (e.g., 01/01–02/01 billed on 02/01).

No usage quantities were provided; usage rows are included with Quantity=0 and Amount=0 as placeholders—actual invoiced quantities/amounts will be driven by usage imports and any overage classification/depletion logic.
Taxes, invoice consolidation rules, and bill run schedule/timing (e.g., actual invoice generation date vs target billing date) are not modeled; Invoice Date is assumed to equal Billing Date.
open_questions: Should Monthly InArrears billing dates be the last day of the month (e.g., 01/31/2026) instead of the next period start (02/01/2026), based on your Zuora bill cycle day and bill run schedule?
Is Metered Storage definitely in-scope for this subscription, or should those usage rows be excluded unless the option is selected?
Is the Professional Services 'Go-Live Milestone' truly on 01/01/2026 (same day as kickoff), or is there a different specific go-live date for invoicing the second 50%?
Should the 10% bundle discount be represented as separate discount charge(s) (for RevPro allocation/POB presentation) rather than netting the Unit Price on the commitment/services charges?

For overage: do you want invoices only for usage explicitly flagged as overage, or should the system automatically start billing overage once the prepaid credit pool is depleted (and if so, how is depletion tracked—Prepaid Balance, drawdown, or custom logic)?

assumptions: The 10% negotiated bundle discount is applied to the committed capacity ramp charges and professional services only (not applied to PayGo overage or metered storage).
SSP is proxied by List Price (per your instruction), so SSP Price = Unit List Price for allocation-eligible lines.
Transaction Price used for allocation = (Total SSP for allocation-eligible lines) minus 10% discount; allocation is performed across the eligible POBs using relative SSP.

Usage-based charges (Overage, Storage) have no committed quantity at booking; Ordered Qty is set to 0 and Ext Sell/Allocated are 0 at contract inception; revenue will be created/released as usage is billed/imported.
Capacity Commitment is treated as prepaid/deferred and released based on usage events (not straight-line).
Ramp is modeled as three annual segments (12 months each) within a 36-month subscription term.
Go-Live milestone revenue date is assumed to be 2026-06-01 per the provided POB mapping.
open_questions: Confirm whether the optional Metered Storage component is truly in-scope for this order form, and if so whether the 10% bundle discount should also apply to storage.
Confirm the intended Go-Live milestone date: Contract Intel lists Go-Live Date as 2026-01-01, but the POB mapping uses 2026-06-01.
Confirm how usage records will distinguish ‘drawdown’ (against prepaid commit) vs ‘overage’ (billable PayGo) to ensure correct release vs billing behavior.
Confirm whether Professional Services should be point-in-time at each milestone (as mapped) or recognized over time during Year 1 (which would require a different POB template/release pattern).

assumptions: Recognition windows are treated as start-date inclusive and end-date exclusive (e.g., 2026-01-01 to 2027-01-01 produces periods Jan-26 through Dec-26).
No consumption (usage) events were provided for EVT-PIT-CONSUMP-USAGE POBs, so revenue is $0 in every period until consumption data is supplied (per WATERFALL INSTRUCTIONS).
No billing/invoice events were provided for BL-PIT-CONSUMP-PAYGO POBs, so revenue is $0 in every period until billing data is supplied (per WATERFALL INSTRUCTIONS).
Milestone 'Completion' event dates are assumed to occur on the Recognition Window date provided for each PS milestone (Kickoff: 2026-01-01; Go-Live: 2026-06-01).
open_questions: For Lines 1–3 (Capacity Commitment prepaid): please provide consumption events by month (or transaction-level) and the prepaid pool unit rate so revenue can be released as (units consumed × unit rate) within each year’s recognition window.
For Lines 6–7 (PayGo usage): please provide billing/invoice events (invoice date and billed amount per month) so revenue can be recognized 'Upon Billing' in the correct periods.
Please confirm whether each end date (e.g., 2027-01-01) is exclusive (service through 2026-12-31) as assumed; if it is inclusive, the period set and timing will change.

assumptions: Commercial structure is a single 36‑month subscription term from 2026-01-01 through 2029-01-01, with an annual ramp modeled as three distinct 12‑month commitment segments (Year 1: $750,000; Year 2: $1,250,000; Year 3: $2,000,000).

Each annual commitment segment is billed annually in advance on the segment start date (invoice date = billing date = 2026-01-01, 2027-01-01, 2028-01-01), with no proration because segments align exactly to year boundaries.

Capacity commitment is treated as prepaid/deferred and relieved based on actual consumption (usage) events rather than straight-line recognition; any unconsumed balance remains deferred unless an expiry/breakage policy is later defined.

Overage consumption is a separate monthly usage charge billed in arrears at $5.75 per credit and recognized as usage is billed/consumed (depending on template choice); it is triggered only after the committed balance is depleted and/or when usage is explicitly classified as overage.

Optional metered storage (if included) is a separate monthly usage charge at $30 per TB-month billed in arrears and explicitly kept out of the committed credit pool for clarity and separation of pools/valuation.

Professional Services (PS) is a fixed-fee SOW of $200,000 sold with the commit, invoiced 50% at kickoff and 50% at go-live (milestone-based billing), with intent that services support adoption during Year 1.

A negotiated bundle discount of 10% applies only to the commitment ramp charges and PS charges (not to overage or storage). The discount is represented as net pricing (sellPrice < listPrice) on the discounted charges unless later changed to explicit discount charge lines.

Revenue allocation is expected to occur in Zuora Revenue using list price as the SSP proxy for allocation-eligible performance obligations (capacity commitment POB(s) and PS POB(s)); transaction price is the discounted sell price and the discount is allocated on a relative-SSP basis.

Revenue recognition templates are assumed as follows unless changed: commitment is event-driven (as-consumed) despite annual upfront billing; overage/storage are recognized in the billed period (monthly in arrears) unless you switch to event-timing recognition; PS milestones are recognized on milestone completion events (or acceptance if required).

Operationally, usage-based charges (overage and storage) have no committed quantity at booking; initial ordered quantity and initial extended amounts are treated as zero and are created/released only when usage/billing data is imported.
For illustration only, consumption events for drawdown were assumed to be monetized using an example $/credit rate to populate amounts; actual monetization method and rate are not yet confirmed.

Billing mechanics not modeled in detail: taxes, invoice consolidation rules, and actual bill run timing (invoice date assumed equal to target billing date). Monthly in-arrears billing dates are modeled as the 1st day of the following month (period end) for simplicity.

For the sample rev-rec timing logic, recognition windows are treated as start-date inclusive and end-date exclusive (e.g., 2026-01-01 to 2027-01-01 covers Jan–Dec 2026). In the absence of imported consumption or billing events, revenue remains $0 in period waterfalls until those events are provided.
Demo milestone dates used where not provided: kickoff milestone is assumed on 2026-01-01 and go-live milestone is assumed on 2026-06-01; replace with actual contractual/acceptance dates.
open_questions: [BLOCKING] What is the authoritative go-live milestone date for the PS second 50% invoice/recognition, and is the controlling criterion 'Completion' or 'Customer Acceptance'? (This affects both billing schedule and PS revenue timing.)

[BLOCKING] For capacity drawdown recognition, what is the contractual valuation method for consumption events: credits-only, dollars-only, or both—and should Zuora Revenue releases be quantity-driven (units × rate) or amount-driven? (This determines the correct event template/fields.)

[BLOCKING] What is the committed drawdown rate (implied $ per credit) used to convert consumed credits into revenue release amounts, and does it vary by contract year/ramp segment? (This drives the release calculation and year-by-year deferral buckets.)

[BLOCKING] Do committed credits expire annually (use-it-or-lose-it), roll forward across years, or require a year-end true-up? If expiry exists, what is the breakage policy/timing? (This affects deferred balance behavior and potential breakage recognition.)

[BLOCKING] How will usage records distinguish drawdown (consume prepaid) vs overage (billable PayGo)? If you want automatic overage once depleted, where/how is depletion tracked (e.g., Prepaid Balance, custom balance, external meter)? (This affects rating, billing eligibility, and correct rev release vs billing.)

[HIGH] Should Professional Services be recognized strictly as two point-in-time milestones, or partially/fully over time during Year 1 based on SOW delivery terms (e.g., hours/effort or continuous transfer)? (This changes the PS POB template and revenue pattern.)

[HIGH] For overage and storage recognition, do you want revenue recognized strictly upon billing (invoice-driven) or strictly upon consumption timing (event-driven), independent of invoice timing? (This determines whether to use a billing-triggered vs event-triggered template.)

[MEDIUM] Should monthly in-arrears usage invoices be dated on the last day of the month (e.g., 2026-01-31) or on the next period start (e.g., 2026-02-01), based on your bill cycle day and bill run process? (This affects invoice dating and period cutoffs.)

[MEDIUM] Is optional Metered Storage truly in-scope for this order form, and if included, should the 10% bundle discount also apply to storage or remain excluded? (This affects pricing/discount scope and allocation population.)

[MEDIUM] Do you want the 10% bundle discount represented as explicit discount charge line(s) (for billing presentation and RevPro/Zuora Revenue reporting) versus netting unit price on discounted charges? (This affects order structure and POB presentation.)

[LOW] Please confirm whether the end dates (e.g., 2027-01-01) should be treated as exclusive (service through 2026-12-31) or inclusive. (This affects period counts and exact revenue/billing boundary dates.)
